Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to mono/2018-04" (#1503) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[plots] Get logcat output for timing in the tasks" (#1502) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Lately the BCL tests started to produce a lot of logcat output, way
over the 4M limit of the buffer.

Thus we need to get the logcat output after every apk test run.

I have considered to batch the `RunTestApks` target. That would not
work very well though, as we are already batching the tasks in this
target with two related different item groups. So I moved the
collection of the logcat output to the `RunInstrumentationTests` and
`RunUITests` tasks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS 15.6.4 - Xamarin Android App - Intallation Errors: XA5209 Unzipping failed" (#1475) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. In VS 2017 15.6.4 create a Xamarin.Forms app using MasterDetail template and .Net Core library option
2.  You will see the error during creation of the Xamarin.Android project as well as during the rebuild process. ( VS 2017 15.7.2 preview doesn't throw this error. I have that preview running on my same PC in side by side )
3.  Sample project attached as below - 
[XF1564Apps.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1849135/XF1564Apps.zip)

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->




### Expected Behavior
Application to be created and compiled 
### Actual Behavior

_**Expected behavior is Visual Studio GA release to work flawlessely without causing our productivity loss. These releases have utterly poor quality. Please have a rigor to test VS Xamarin releases on both MAC and Windows tested thoroughly. We don't need Xamarin engineering team members just to support and celebrate Apple platform for the delivery. This is really getting annoying. Please improve quality, performance and stability in these releases.**_

**See the console output attached below -**
..............................

Severity Code Description Project File Line Suppression State
Error An error occurred trying to install required android components on Project 'XFHello1564.Android'.
Project 'XFHello1564.Android' requires the following components installed on your machine: 
Xamarin.Android.Support.CustomTabs
JavaLibraryReference: https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/repository/android_m2repository_r29.zip-m2repository/com/android/support/customtabs/23.3.0/customtabs-23.3.0.aar-23.3.0.0
AndroidResources: https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/repository/android_m2repository_r29.zip-m2repository/com/android/support/customtabs/23.3.0/customtabs-23.3.0.aar-23.3.0.0


Please double-click here to install it.

Intallation Errors: XA5209 Unzipping failed. Please download 'https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/repository/android_m2repository_r29.zip' and extract it to the 'C:\Users*\AppData\Local\Xamarin\Xamarin.Android.Support.CustomTabs\23.3.0.0\content' directory
XA5209 Reason: Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Users*\AppData\Local\Xamarin\Xamarin.Android.Support.CustomTabs\23.3.0.0\content\m2repository\'.
XA5207 Please install package: 'Xamarin.Android.Support.CustomTabs' available in SDK installer. Java library file 'C:\Users*\AppData\Local\Xamarin\Xamarin.Android.Support.CustomTabs\23.3.0.0\content\classes.jar' doesn't exist. 0 

..............................

**A warning displayed as -** 
The project type included Xamarin Forms app using master detail and .net core library options. Target OS included Andorid, iOS and UWP. 
..............................
**Cleaning of the solution fails as well** 
Cleaning of the solution also throws error on the windows status bar with the message "Clean Cancelled"


### Version Information
Windows 10 64 bit; VS 2017 15.6.4| Andoroid  API min 23 max 27| VS Android Emulator using API 23

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

-->

    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

2. Paste below this comment block
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Encountering test failure in MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus (monodroid_System_test)" (#1312) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Copy over the relevant test source linked below into a new Android project and attempt to run on a device with an internet connection.

https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System/Test/System.Net.Sockets/SocketTest.cs#L166

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Test should pass.

### Actual Behavior
Test fails with: `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException : Connection timed out`.

### Version Information
mono-2017-12
https://gist.github.com/pjcollins/43e1e192125ac5db93c1af50faaffee8

### Log File
```
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   : MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus (monodroid_System_test)
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   : System.Net.Sockets.SocketException : Connection timed out
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Connect (System.Net.EndPoint remoteEP) [0x000b6] in <18fabd7f050747018bc25451e9833036>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.BlockingConnect (System.Boolean block, System.Int32 port) [0x00033] in <049e9d62f5d74935bebf1e2906ae30b7>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus () [0x00006] in <049e9d62f5d74935bebf1e2906ae30b7>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.MonoMethod.InternalInvoke(System.Reflection.MonoMethod,object,object[],System.Exception&)
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at System.Reflection.MonoMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x00032] in <3e87052017124b0aa0d514e8df5eadbc>:0
```

> VS bug [#594098](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/594098)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks]  error "resource directory obj\debug\res does not exist"" (#1490) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/588716

Also relates to errors such as

	"obj\Debug-Automatic\android\bin\packaged_resources" does not exist.
	error "resource directory obj\debug\res does not exist"

We have a serious problem with our Async Task system. The fact that
the background thread is executing in a certain directory cannot be
relied upon. So we need to provide full paths to the various file
items we are using in `Aapt` as well as ensure that the Working
Directory is set for the tools we are launching on the background
threads.

In this PR we are adding a `WorkingDirectory` property to `AsyncTask`.
This will allow us to always know where the task was started. We
can then use this information to build a full path for those files
which are not rooted.

Also on advice from the msbuild team the use of `Yield` and `Reaquire`
has been reworked. Rather than yielding the MSBuild Node just before
we enter the message loop, we should yield BEFORE we start the
threads. This should in theory help reduce the directory changes, but
it did not eliminate them completely. We a result we had to also
make the changes regarding using full paths.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Makefile was missing another `build-tools/mono-runtimes` specification." (#1497) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "Android/Forms Tabpage OnAppearing being called twice" (#2240) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=51574

Correct me if I am wrong but pretty certain this issue below is similar but not the same as it is regarding the OnDisappearing (see below):
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1438

### Description

The OnAppearing method is being called twice for the child tab contentpage that is being displayed when TabbedPage is set as main page of application.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run app with TabbedPage set a mainpage which has Tab1Page and Tab2Page as its children.
2. Tab1Page OnAppearing method being called twice
3. Tab2Page OnAppearing method called once

### Expected Behavior

Tab1Page Constructor called.
Tab2Page Constructor called.
Tab1Page OnAppearing method called first time.
Tab2Page OnAppearing method called first time.

### Actual Behavior
Tab1Page Constructor called.
Tab2Page Constructor called.
Tab1Page OnAppearing method called first time.
Tab1Page OnDisappearing method called first time.
Tab1Page OnAppearing method called second time.
Tab2Page OnAppearing method called first time.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "crash : XamarinFormsPrevieweriOS quit unexpectedly." (#2213) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
The IDE is crashing several times per minutes, and display this error : 
XamarinFormsPrevieweriOS quit unexpectedly.

### Steps to Reproduce

Create a Forms cross platform app
Add some text and button in the XAML
Display the preview 

### Expected Behavior
The error message should not appear

### Actual Behavior
The error message appear several time per minutes, which is annoying.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: visual studio community 7.4.1 build 48
- Last known good version: none
- IDE: visual studio community 7.4.1 build 48
- MACOS High sierra 10.13.3

this code is the xaml i Use : 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<ContentPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml" xmlns:local="clr-namespace:cupidon_xamarin" x:Class="cupidon_xamarin.cupidon_xamarinPage">
    <StackLayout>
        <Label Text="Welcome to Xamarin Forms!" VerticalOptions="Center" HorizontalOptions="Center" />
        <Button x:Name="TakePhotoBtn" Text="Take Photo"/>
        <Button x:Name="UploadTextBtn" Text="Upload TEXT"/>
        <Label TextColor="#934293" Text="Swanky" FontSize="80">  
        <Label.FontFamily>
            <OnPlatform x:TypeArguments="x:String">
                <On Platform="iOS">Chicle</On>
                <On Platform="Android">Chicle-Regular.ttf#Chicle</On>
            </OnPlatform>
        </Label.FontFamily>
        </Label> 
        
    </StackLayout>
</ContentPage>

### Screenshots

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1X9Xxr66Q5ceplTsxCNdnOOe0h4N1_XUI

> VS bug [#593007](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/593007)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[All] Stepper Maximum does not allow a value less than 1" (#2236) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
It was discovered that while using a Stepper control and setting/binding the Maximum property to a value less than 1 would throw a ArgumentException. The exception states that the Maximum property was invalid.

Here is a reproduction project of the issue. This is just a barebones project created with the Visual Studio 2017 Xamarin project template using .NET Standard. [StepperRepo.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1873238/StepperRepo.zip)

Here is the XAML code for the stepper:
`<Stepper
    Value="-2"
    Maximum="-5"
    Minimum="-1"
    VerticalOptions="Center"
    HorizontalOptions="Center"
/>`

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the reproduction project
2. Target any platform (The MainPage.xaml should already have the Stepper setup)
3. Run the application

### Expected Behavior
The control should allow for a negative range of numbers for example: Minimum -5 and Maximum: -1

### Actual Behavior
The app throws an ArgumentException stating that the Maximum property is invalid.

### Basic Information
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 15.6.4
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Xamarin: 4.9.0.752
  - Xamarin.Android SDK - 8.2.0.16
  - Xamarin.iOS/Xamarin.Mac SDK - 11.8.1.28
  - UWP:  16299
- Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2
- Xamarin.Forms: 2.5.0.280555
